You will be staying in a lovely, bright 1-bedroom cottage nestled between two beautiful old growth oaks trees and centrally located close to everything Asheville has to offer. description: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more Please note that this tent does not retain heat like a normal home- we have electric blankets and a mattress cover that guarantee that you are warm and comfy sleeping- but the rest of the tent will match the outside temp in the colder months. The bathroom is heated and stays toasty and so does the HOT TUB! :-D  ***To whom it may concern: We are operating a legal rental. Our property is covered under zoning as a campground. As of August of 2015, Asheville has started to enforce the ban on short term rentals that are located within Asheville city limits that are in areas that are zoned residential- our properties are zoned "open use" just outside of Asheville city limits, in West Asheville.  We have been constantly upgrading this site since we offered Asheville's first set up tent rental in April of 2014! We are now pleased to offer our guests a luxury Bell tent fully furnished with everythi
name: Glamping w HOT TUB + AC!

description: This clean and bright West Asheville efficiency HOMESTAY is a convenient 2 minute drive to downtown Asheville or Haywood Road, West Asheville; close to breweries, music venues and amazing restaurants. Located in a cozy and well kept older home (110 years old!), the apartment is a fully furnished bedroom (queen size bed), small kitchen and bath, with linens and towels provided and high speed wireless internet.   The best thing about this home is the location. You can see the downtown Asheville skyline from the side deck, but the back yard feels secluded and woodsy with tons of birds, cicadas at night and lightning bugs in the summer. In the winter, less green, but a nice view of downtown (especially at nighttime)!  You can walk under the highway to the Earthfare grocery store, a drugstore, deli and other amenities, or to Haywood Road, the main drag through West Asheville. description: House in West Asheville. Washer/Dryer, central air, stove, dishwasher, front/back porch and screened in queen bed sleeping/seated area on a wooded lot. This 21 acre property is located just 5 miles from the center of Asheville and only 2 miles from Haywood Rd. in West Asheville.  We're 1 mile outside the city limit. The house was homeowner-built before there were inspectors for such endeavors.  However, it is safe, comfortable and clean.   The best part is that it is SPRING water supplying all our H2O needs! description: I live in a cute 3-bedroom house only 5 minutes from the heart of West Asheville, and less than 10 minutes to downtown. It is rustic like a campground.  If you require perfect cleanliness, this isn't the place for you.  It can be dusty and rustic.  There is one shelving unit that has my camping storage on it.  FYI. There is a ladder to the loft area and a full-sized mattress pad down - upon new carpet padding (surrounded by a bug netting).  You cannot stand up in the loft.  Fresh sheets & pillow cases are provided, as well as towels. The space is used for various art projects, and so part of it is an art explosion, another part is storage. description: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more! Make your trip to Asheville extra memorable when you stay in our fun yurt :-) 5 miles from downtown and 2 to Haywood Rd on 2.5 acres alone (there are no other homes on this 2 plus acre property- the yurt sits alone here) Follow us on INSTAGRAM @ashevilleglamping and check out pictures of our other sites and glamping adventures! Wait.....What's a Yurt?  A yurt (or ger) is a portable living structure originally developed by the nomadic groups of the Central Asian steppes. Original yurts were fashioned from local wood, felt, and braided horse hair. They were designed to be portable for moving as the horse and goat herds were driven across the plains. Strong and light, they could be set up in a day or so and properly equipped to withstand wind and snow that would crush many other dwellings. Modern yurts like ours are made from more contemporary materials (aluminum rivets, aircraft cable, and
name: Yurt! Asheville Glamping! Heat & AC

Guests also have access to my favorite spaces: ~sitting room on the main level perfect for getting in a bit of work on your trip  ~the guest bath in the hallway is shared with my guests in another room and folks that come through during the day, but don't fret - I have a shelf set aside just for you to assure you feel welcome, comfortable, and at your ease while you're staying with me, and the bathroom is cleaned daily ~When the weather is nice, the front and side porches are great spots for a cup of coffee or tea PLEASE NOTE: I own a small Boston Terrier and a Boxer/Pug mix, and occasionally have visits from
name: Eclectic bedroom in West Asheville

description: Be guests in our new home in an upstairs bedroom with a private  bath downstairs. Enjoy living in Asheville for a few days, in a wooded area, but close to everything.  Safety and your enjoyment are our primary concerns. The shady back deck is available for reading, talking, working on your laptop, as well as for breakfast on Saturday in summer.  Sorry, though, cool weather makes the porches less functional. Guests may sit in kitchen for morning coffee/tea and homemade baked goods Tuesday-Friday or on porches in summer. We love to provide information and help, but can also respect quiet time. We are on the edge of West Asheville abutting a private school campus. At two miles distance are great cafes,restaurants and entertainment.  And of course, downtown Asheville has all that and more: 5 miles. Best if you have your own car, but Craig is an Uber driver. Our home is not child ready, and the room is available only for two adults, unless special arrangements are made in advance.
name: West Asheville Woodland Retreat

description: Our house is super homey. Its just the two of us and we are trying to help people out who are visiting asheville we can tell you all about it! Super chill quiet place away from all the hustle and bustle. Come stay! :) It's ours. That's what makes it special. Everything in this house represents a significant part of us and our journey. :) Wifi, cable, bathroom, kitchen, porch, etc. All the time! We are super down to earth people. :) Very quiet and peaceful. You don't hear very many cars, and Warren Wilson College is located down the road and has SPECTACULAR views of the mountains/sunset, as well as many hiking trails and bodies of water and you can see all the animals as you drive by! Plus there's a pretty awesome view from my front porch. :) Right down the road is a bus stop, and there's another one a little bit farther next to the gas station. Uber as well.
name: Cheyenne and Aaron welcome you! :)

description: Our beautiful studio apartment, tucked away in the woods on top of the mountain has so much to offer. description: This is a sweet, quirky little apartment 10 minutes from downtown Asheville. It is a small studio with bedroom, bathroom, living area and kitchenette. Please make sure to read the entire detailed description before booking! This is a very cute, private loft close to downtown Asheville. It's seconds from I-40 so it's very convenient if that's your route into town, and it's a comfortable space if you're looking to unwind after a day (or night) on the town. Here's the catch: This space is on the top floor of an animal hospital. It is directly above the dog kennels, which is why this apartment is probably one of the cheaper ones you're looking at today. It's a bit of a gamble... often there are no dogs spending the night, or the ones there are totally quiet- other times you get a barker or two. I do have a white noise machine in the apartment that works like a charm for me. If you're a light sleeper this might not be the place for you. There is no way to know in advance if there will be do
name: The Kitty Loft

description: Share my 5000 sq. ft. Fantasy Home 3500 ft high above the city  Mountain Views, Chef's Kitchen, Decks & gardens to meander in & do Yoga 5 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway & 10 to town I'm a senior with 2 loving pups, please come visit.......... I have a 5000 sq ft home on top of a mountain yet only 5 minutes away from one of the most famous scenic parkways in America and 10 minutes down to one of the unique towns in the USA: Asheville.  My home built in 2004, sits on almost 1 1/2 acres of almost flat land (rare in the mountains) with places to walk, practice Yoga, or just sit on the deck and read while enjoying the majestic mountains, or if lucky watch mama bear and her cubs walk the property.  Don't worry, no risk, as long as you stay away from the cubs.  The large upstairs bedroom is actually a second master suite with windows in bedroom and bath overlooking the mountains and the gardens plus a small balcony for that first private cup of coffee. description: Rest easy in your light-filled bedroom with a private half-bath and a shared full bath.   Spring has sprung here in Asheville! Now is a great time to enjoy our hiking, river rafting, brew pubs and more! We look forward to meeting you. After a busy day exploring Asheville, rest easy in our north Asheville home. We're in a completely renovated 1940s stone-and-rock house within walking distance of UNCA. You will delight in your colorful, light-filled bedroom with a queen-sized sleigh bed, your own private half-bath, and a shared full bath. You are welcome to cook simple meals in our well appointed kitchen. We have a back porch to watch the sunset or drink your morning coffee. As our guest, we invite you to start your morning with fresh coffee and bagels. We offer complimentary toiletries, fresh linens, WiFi, and no stairs to climb. We are easy to find and centrally located in north Asheville, near everything that makes Asheville so fun. We offer safe, private off-street parking, and cover
name: Your room is ready in Asheville!

This includes a  delicious complementary breakfast "hand crafted" just for you.   We'll  be glad to assist you with your visit. Our newly renovated single story home is very close to Asheville (9 minutes to Pack Square in Asheville.)  Weaverville is only 4 minutes to Main Street via I-26.   Our location provides a great jumping off spot for all that Asheville and Weaverville have to offer. The guest room has a queen-sized bed, dresser, desk, chair, and a reading lamp. We will pamper you with a complimentary breakfast that will be prepared personally for you each day of your stay. You will have safe "on premises" parking.    Susan and Gary are available to give advice about restaurants, bars, hiking zip-lining, biking and other local attractions; including The Grove Park Inn, The Biltmore Estate and the North Carolina Arboretum. description: Comfy queen sized bed, just minutes from Downtown, River Arts, and West Asheville! Fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and laundry are available during your stay.  As well as easy access to the highway, nature hikes, and the Biltmore! Less than five minutes to Downtown, River arts, and West Asheville, this lush private room has a comfy queen sized bed, a private workspace, and a shared bathroom.  You are welcome to use anything in the kitchen, laundry, and record player, just keep in mind there is a possibility of these spaces being used by other guests, or myself, on occasion. Look at it as an opportunity to expand your horizons and meet other awesome people! description: Majestic home with remarkable views which is what has made Asheville famous. In addition to being 5 minutes from the spectacular Blue Ridge Parkway you will be 10 minutes to downtown Asheville yet in a tranquil setting.  The attached photos and reviews say it all. The apartment is about 1,000 sq ft, with sitting area, full balcony to sit and enjoy coffee, tea and croissant.  The Keurig coffee machine, microwave and mini-fridge are there for those midnight snacks or simple breakfasts you want to make for yourselves in order to go out to the balcony and watch the mountains come out of the mist. A television in the living room and the bedroom with a full selection of cable channels as well as local ones.  Of course free wi-fi and excellent internet even here 3,500 ft up. description: South facing, downtown & long views. Enjoy a secluded, peaceful home away from home with private outdoor spaces, sauna, hot tub & outdoor shower. You're only 10-12 minutes  and four miles from bustling Asheville. Fabulous views from almost 3000 feet. This is an extraordinary contemporary style property with great location & with a similar views as the Grove Park Inn. Ceilings are high, & the entire south facing is windows with 30-40 mile views (on a clear day). description: Bittersweet Cottage is a wonderful retreat from your everyday cares.  The one-bedroom cottage is located between downtown Asheville land the Blue Ridge Parkway.  We think it has everything you need for a relaxing getaway.  We hope you feel the same. Bittersweet Cottage is a self-catered free-standing accommodation. The location is ideal.  We are only 5 miles from downtown yet offer outstanding city and long-range mountain views.  You can listen to the sounds of the beautiful waterfall while soaking in your private hot tub, feed the koi in the pond and, well, just let it all go.   Guests have access to the 2 acre compound.  Feel free to stroll around. There are no shared amenities.   We are always available  but endeavor to stay out of the way.   We have been in the vacation rental business for over 11 years and have found that most folks just want to do their own thing.  That doesn't mean that we wouldn't be happy to have a glass of wine and get to know you better, but we will leave th

description: My custom-built THOW sits just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville on the Weaverville line. It is bright and airy with a mountain view in the winter and beautiful woods on one side. It was recently featured on an episode of HGTV's Tiny House Hunters!! The house is 130 square feet plus sleeping lofts. It sits on an 18 foot trailer. I am usually around but even if I'm out of town I'm always available by text, phone, or e-mail. I call this kind of area "urban country" meaning that it's dark and quiet at night and has some of the quirks of the countryside but you can still see the neighbors' homes and have very quick access to any urban amenities you might want. The property is about 1 mile from Interstate 26...super easy access! The house is off of a private gravel road. You will occasionally have lights from a car or truck shine briefly into the windows of the tiny house as they pass by. Hot water tank is only 12 gallons so plan ahead for multiple users!!
name: Modern Tiny House on Wheels

description: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our accommodations consist of beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930s. Relax and rock away your stress with a tranquil stay in the Happy Haven cabin.   This cabin comes with a rocking chair front porch, small refrigerator, a queen bed and sleeps 2 people.    Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have FREE wireless access, today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance. A rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember. This newly built and decorated space is the perfect retreat. Environments are very important to me.  I've worked hard to create a space that feels serene and comforting.  The aesthetic is clean, cozy, and modern with a rustic twist.  The decor captures some of the Appalachian culture so many come to this region to experience.   The apartment is the entire bottom floor of a house (in which I live in the top two floors)  You will have your own entrance with plenty of privacy. description: The Black Bear Lodge is part of the Log Cabin Motor Court, a group of 18 cabins located approximately 6 miles from downtown Asheville.  Located in a wooded setting between Interstate 26 and Highway 25. The Black Bear Lodge is close to Interstate 26. Only 6 miles to downtown Asheville, the Black Bear Lodge has a full kitchen, dining room, living room, balcony, gas log fireplace, wood burning fireplace, 1 king bed, 2 queen beds (one queen bed is in an open loft), a double bed, a fold out queen futon sofa and sleeps 10 people. Cable TV, DVD player, wireless broadband and air conditioning are provided.  The Black Bear Lodge is part of the Log Cabin Motor Court and is located at the top of the hill near I26. You will be surrounded by nature but will hear traffic noise from the interstate.  We have had the noise tested and it is no more than your average residential area. name: Black Bear Lodge - Asheville

Located in one of Asheville's best areas, this comfortable oasis is close to everything! You'll feel right at home in this clean, beautifully decorated home. The open flow of the kitchen, dining and living areas gives you plenty of room to relax with your loved ones.  Both bedrooms feature comfortable queen-sized beds. The master boasts an en suite bathroom complete with a walk-in spa shower. There is also a small sitting room for reading. Have little ones? Thanks to its full-sized crib, the sitting room can also double as a nursery.  If you enjoy relaxing outdoors, you'll love the front porch with its white wooden rocking chairs and porch swing. description: Location, convenience, privacy describe this apartment which is part of the main floor of my home.  You will be staying near downtown in an 1880s "Queen Anne" home with modern conveniences, and you can park just outside your door. Welcome to our beautifully appointed three-room suite on the main floor of this lovingly restored, owner occupied, 1880's “Queen Anne" home.  Although we are located very near to the lively downtown Asheville area, the large lot is surrounded by trees and lush vegetation which affords a great deal of privacy and the feeling that you are “away from it all".  We are located at the base of Town Mountain, just a short walk to downtown as well as neighborhood restaurants, coffee houses, shopping and entertainment.  There are fireplaces in each of the rooms, yes, even the bathroom which also features a large glass shower and fluffy towels.  The bedroom has a queen size bed with fresh linens. Just off the living/dining area there's a “mini" kitchen complete with bar
name: Secluded Setting near downtown

description: A little piece of paradise just 5 miles from downtown Asheville.  Our cute stand alone cottage has private parking, deck, and garden. description: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have FREE wireless access, today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance. A rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember. Views The house sits at the end of a cup-de-sac. The upstairs is also on AirBnB so may be occupied the same dates as downstairs, but the privacy of each is great. The house sits on a lot of land and feels very private. Yet, you can walk to Beaver Lake in fifteen minutes and walk around the lake and back for a good 4 mile jaunt. You will share a carport and driveway with guests upstairs. There is plenty of parking as the house sits in a cul-de-sac. I'll be there for you as much as you need me to be but I like to stay pretty behind the scenes. Please do feel free to text me with questions. Since I grew up on Cherry Lane, in the house next door, I have many fond and magical memories. Today, it still holds that magic. It's a family centered neighborhood and
name: Fabulous Studio 10 min to downtown!

description: Our apartment is in a remodeled old hotel off a main road in North Asheville. Years ago the hotel was converted into business spaces. We have converted 3 rooms into a big and wonderful apartment for friends and vacationers! A unique and charming lofty space located extremely centrally (only a five minute drive to the center of downtown). We run a candle business right next door, so we're usually around to say 'hello' and give recommendations. There are three rooms to the apartment - the bedroom and bathroom, tucked back in the quietest part of the building, which connects to adjoined rooms for the living and dining areas. There is one parking space right in front, and extremely easy parking for additional cars on a quiet neighborhood street next door. We run a wholesale candle company on the other half of the floor, and our home is only one mile away so we're so we're usually around to say hello and give recommendations and always available to stop by if you need something. This is a small yard in back and front. Handicap accessible from rear entrance. Please feel free to call or text me. (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) North Asheville, right next to Botanical Gardens and UNCA.  1.5 miles from downtown Asheville. There is no dishwasher or Cable TV. description: Enjoy spectacular views of downtown and the mountains beyond from the comfort of your mountainside retreat. Venture into town or hike on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Either choice is only a few miles away and offer the best of both worlds. If a killer view is high on your wish list the Suite at Bittersweet will blow you away.  The vistas of the city and Blue Ridge Mountains are simply stunning.  Sunsets are breathtaking and not to be missed.  Come visit. You may never leave! Guests have access to the 2 acre compound.  Feel free to stroll around. There are no shared amenities.   We are always available  but endeavor to stay out of the way.   We have been in the vacation rental business for over 11 years and have found that most folks just want to do their own thing.  That does not mean that we wouldn't be happy to have a glass of wine and get to know you better, but we will leave that up to you. North Asheville has just about anything you can think of - DOUGH is a very popular bakery/cafe.
name: The Suite at Bittersweet

description: This beautiful skylit apartment is located in the heart of Historic Biltmore Village only yards from the entrance to The Biltmore Estate and less than 3 miles to downtown Asheville's vibrant and eclectic scene. Only steps from Dining and Shopping. This unit is located in the Heart of Historic Biltmore Village within steps of oodles of shopping and dining options.  It is brand new in 2016 and has all the amenities for a truly enjoyable stay.  Parking is free in the Village and should not be a problem before noon or after 5pm. Guests will enter through the exterior private glass door on Swan Street and then access their front door via coded lockbox- no keys to find or forget. We are available via cell phone and have a staff at The Cantina that can assist from 11a to 9p. The neighborhood is the Village developed by  Frederick Law Olmsted in the early 1900s for the workers that built The Biltmore estate.  The Village was designed for everything the Villagers needed and boasts that same fee
name: Historic Biltmore Village Asheville

description: If you want to use the second bedroom, request for a party of at least 3 people. Note that there is a $40 per person per night guest charge for this second room. Art collection from Penland School of Crafts. Queen bed in each bedroom.  Tub/shower combination in bathroom.  Minimum two night stay. I am also in residence with my dog Clancie. You may use the kitchen and living area but is not private. You will have access to the full house (living, dining, and kitchen), patio, gardens, and on-property hiking trail (master bedroom and bath excluded).  I will be in residence with my cavalier king charles spaniel.  Wifi available. Continental breakfast included.  I am happy to help organize activities while you are in Asheville. description: Whether you are planning a vacation to our beautiful town, or traveling for business, The Cottage on Parkway Loop offers you a comfortably elegant alternative to sterile hotel rooms. At 600 sq ft the recently renovated Cottage has a lot to offer for its diminutive size.  Downstairs are the living room, kitchen, and dining areas.  A full bath with claw-foot tub and laundry adjoins the living room. Upstairs is the master bedroom with king- sized bed and half bath. This light filled room is tucked into a dormer with large windows looking out into a canopy of trees.  A small nook entices you to stay and read a while.    The fully equipped custom kitchen has a dishwasher, stove, microwave, and refrigerator. Instead enjoy modern furnishings, Wi-Fi, the owners' contemporary art collection and gourmet coffee. Cottage is situated in one of The Grove Park neighborhood's historic gardens. description: Located within walking distance to downtown, our fully renovated c1926 cottage is located in historic Montford, and is convenient to all the Asheville area has to offer.  We are available to help you make the most of your stay here! Within walking distance to downtown, this fully renovated 1920's cottage is ideal for exploring all that Asheville and WNC have to offer!  Wireless internet, off-street parking, Satellite TV, and your hosts are located just across the street to assist you with your stay.  Fully equipped kitchen, linens provided.  Pet friendly upon approval. Entire home. We live just across the street from the cottage, and are available to help with anything to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable! The oldest neighborhood in Asheville, Montford is a unique gem. description: Walk to the heart of downtown Asheville in less than 10-minutes!  We are located steps from the minor league baseball field.  Hardwood floors throughout, washer and dryer, shared bathroom (there's only one in the home), likely the best kitchen in Asheville, front porch with a view of the blue ridge mountains, and a fenced in backyard.  In the summer enjoy fresh blueberries, tomatoes and various fresh vegetables from the garden; or, walk to the Saturday farmer's market.   Two rooms are rented via Airbnb or long-term (3-months for traveling nurses and P.T. interns at the hospital), the third room in the home is mine (I live here).  We will consider a well-behaved dog with deposit.  I have one LARGE pooch (85 pounds) currently.   Note: The steps to get up to my house are "steep", with no handrails. You can walk up the driveway and enter in the back of the home (no steps). Please don't park in or block the driveway, unless you need to unload.  I'm a female, outdoor person who loves biking,
name: AA Asheville Walk to Downtown!!

We are far enough out, though, that we still get a restful night's sleep.  Please pardon the photo quality. This summer we repainted and refreshed our whole condo. We have homespun pictures at the moment, but are getting higher quality pics soon.  We would love to have you come share our home! You would have your own bedroom with a sunset view looking towards downtown. You would also have access to the kitchen, living room, bathroom, wifi, and parking. Our home is pet-free. It is located on the bottom level of our beautiful 1920's craftsman bungalow in the heart of downtown Asheville. We have spent this winter designing and constructing a beautiful and bright downstairs apartment in our 1920's Craftsman style bungalow in downtown Asheville.  We are full-time farmers and full-time parents and are looking forward to hosting families, couples and friends in our new space.  Our family lives upstairs and the downstairs apartment is one bedroom, one bathroom with large and bright windows throughout.  The bathroom has the old cast iron tub original to the house, new fixtures, pedestal sink and travertine tile floors (throughout the apartment). I will be happy to answer any questions/concerns you have regarding the apartment and will do my best to be prompt in answering those concerns. Quiet and safe apartment complex. Up a characteristic "hilly" road of Asheville, not far from downtown, with beautiful views. No assigned parking. Walking distance to downtown. 10 min walk to the baseball stadium, which hosts game in the summer. 5 min driving from a grocery store, 5 min to an interstate, 5-10 min from the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village. 10-15 min driving to the Parkway.

description: Downtown 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom Apartment With Free Off Street Parking For 2 Cars Finally, there's an answer to champagne tastes on a beer budget: the hip, affordable and new-to-market Ann Street Suite. One of Asheville's freshest rentals, this sweet suite doesn't sacrifice luxury for affordability: bold artwork and stylish furnishings, sprinkled with a helping of modern chic, decorate the apartment – the epitome of Asheville's artsy-cool vibe. Summit the stairs to this top-floor apartment, situated right in the center of Asheville's vibrant arts scene, and open the door to a space bathed in creativity. Pops of color pepper the apartment and metal-mounted graffiti art and local WNC landscape photography decorate the walls. Twin bedrooms offer cushy Tempur-Pedic mattresses – take your pick of king or double -– and the kitchen is outfitted in high-end Ikea. Walk back downstairs, and at your feet are all of Asheville's downtown eateries, art galleries, breweries and cultural destinations.
name: Champagne Tastes on a Beer Budget

description: A mere 5 min walk from downtown, our cozy, sun-drenched apartment will be the perfect home base for your next Asheville retreat. Built in 1921, this spot is tucked between Harris Teeter, Trader Joes, Green Life and High Five Coffee. Historic brick apartment building circa 1921. Well preserved. Well-designed. Wifi, Roku TV, Netflix, HBO Go, Hulu Plus, full kitchen, record player, Keurig coffee (complimentary) or coffee press, clean linens and lots of sunlight through our arch windows. None whatsoever (save maybe a key hand-off). Iconic 5 Points neighborhood within walking distance of downtown Asheville. Conveniently next to Harris Teeter, Green Life, Trader Joes and High Five Coffee (one of the best coffee shops in Asheville). Walking or Art Bus. Street parking readily available on sides of building. More details once booked.

description: An artist's unique 2 floor cabin from the 1830's reconstructed in the Chestnut Hill neighborhood, 5 blocks north of downtown. Open layout with first floor lounge/kitchen and master bedroom for guests on the entire second floor! The cabin interior is all wood and is bedecked with unique textiles and objects I have collected on my travels as well as finely handcrafted items. Certainly touch and appreciate, but please use care as if items were precious to you too! There is no television, however, a cd/ipod dock/radio as well as speakers for your computer or phone are available for your listening enjoyment. The kitchen is a meat free zone equipped with an electric water kettle, french press, espresso machine, coffee bean grinder, blender and juicer, filtered water, a gas range/oven and cast iron pans. Please don't use soap on the cast iron when washing and yes, you will have to wash your dishes by hand…no dishwasher and no mircowave. For those staying long enough to need to wash/dry laundr

description: Stay in downtown Asheville and walk everywhere! description: I love this space and I know you will too. A short walk to The Orange Peel and a one mile walk from the heart of Downtown Asheville, with a beautiful view of Mount Pisgah. The bedroom you'll use is actually mine, but it's so comfortable, I thought I'd let you have it. :) Private entrance for you to the bathroom. Other door is in the hall... which I use. My room / massage room is at the end of the hall. I will give you my phone number, so I am always a text or call away. I'm happy to answer any questions about the area. I'm new here myself, but living and working downtown, I've caught on to some cool spots.  I work weekends so we really won't see each other much. description: This one bedroom, one bath studio is located in the back of my beautifully restored 1920s bungalow in downtown Asheville. The studio apartment, located in the back part of my house, is decorated with a mix of modern and vintage furniture. Some have been in my life for a long time, some brand new to the space, and art made by me hangs on the walls. There's a small kitchenette with table and chairs, a bedroom with exposed brick from an old cooks stove and a living area with a very cozy pullout couch. The full bath has a claw foot tub/shower that has a custom copper curtain rod and antique heirloom vanity. This is a perfect retreat for two people, but can accommodate four if necessary. The private entrance is in the back of the house, with a cozy porch all to yourself. There is plenty of parking on the street. I will provide you with a parking pass to hang on your rearview mirror. To enter the apartment, simply walk along the driveway to the right of the house and the door is in the back

Queen bed upstairs, walk-in shower, open, clean and airy. We hope you will be delighted and maybe even inspired by the ease and gentleness of our home. description: The one bedroom apartment sits at the base of mt Pisgah. Enjoy the quiet of the woods and sounds of the creek while still staying close enough to downtown Asheville to enjoy the art galleries and night life. Lots of fruit and flowers growing here. The best thing about this place is the outdoors. A creek runs through the front yard. There is a fire pit, gas grill and a wood/charcoal grill available for your use. When the weather is warm enjoy the badminton court or some bocce ball. You are just minutes away from the blue ridge parkway and mount Pisgah. There are lots of great hikes and waterfalls within just a few miles of the property.  The bedroom has a queen size bed and there is a fold out couch in the living room which is great for the kids. description: Built in 1903 and renovated in 2008, our farmhouse has the coziness of an old country home and the vitality of a modern art gallery. A full cascade of windows show off beautiful Hominy Valley and is only 20 minutes from downtown Asheville. Multiple indoor and outdoor sitting areas create opportunities for big parties and intimate conversations. Anne's remarkable collection of modern art and Tom's handmade quilts inhabit the rest of this wonderful gathering space. A horseshoe pit, badminton, bocce balls, and two wonderful swimming holes open up a lifetime of memories. If fishing is your thing, Davis Creek has been restored by the NC Department of Environment and Natural Resources as a protected trout habitat. Mount Pisgah, an easy 1.3 hike and is only 10 minutes away. Feel free to explore the garden and gather what the season has to offer. Our fully appointed modern kitchen has everything the avid cook might need. Whistlepig Farm is available for weddings and events yet different rates
name: Whistlepig Farm

Top that off with views across the valley to Mt. Pisgah,  and it's a great deal. This space is about the size of a large hotel room. This garage apt. is detached from the house. It is the second floor of the garage. You have access to the whole apt. as well as the property. We farm vegetables for fine restaurants, co-op, & farm markets. Our farm, our home, is serene and private. We are 20 minutes from downtown Asheville.  The barn room is up 8 steps over the packing house where we prepare and pack vegetables for market.  Most of the upstairs of the packing house is the farm's 'attic' with the Barn Room as a separate 11x17 space that is furnished with full bed/linens, slider chair/footstool, TV w/DVDs, etc.  It was built for root vegetable storage before being converted to a cozy bedroom. Since we have cut back on planting root vegetables, we are able to share this cheery, private room with airBnB guests. It is about 25 yards to the Bathrooms/Showers or to the Kitchen. description: Come stay with us in our beautiful stone home, just 15 min from downtown Asheville. It is in a country neighborhood and you can see the stars at night! Enjoy the gardens, chickens, dog, and cats. We'd love to have you! Kathleen & John Gardens surround this charming homestead with rare trees & shrubs, flowers, and fresh vegetables. The living room wood-burning stove creates a cozy place (in season) to read, talk, or watch a movie. There is off-street parking and a friendly, helpful hostess. We have made quite a few improvements  here lately and the homestead is now even prettier and more comfortable! It may just remind you of your grandmother's house. Many people think that the best things here are the two outdoor covered porches where you can sit and eat, chat, or enjoy a drink.  Outside in the gardens you'll find a hammock, a covered swing, benches, and tables & chairs with umbrellas for your enjoyment.  Your delightful, private, sunny, 2nd floor space has a half-bath right in the roo
name: Stone Cottage Garden Homestay TWO

We love to host you and make our favorite local recommendations! Our guest bedroom with queen-size bed and living area with a full-size fold-out futon are in the finished basement of our 1940's home.  There is a walk-in private entrance at the back of the house, inside of the fenced yard.  A private bathroom with rustic claw foot tub/shower is stocked with towels and washcloths.  There are extra blankets, pillows and towels in the guestroom closet, an extra queen size air mattress if you'd like to really pack in the guests, as well as a "Pack-n-Play" crib for your use if you're bringing a little one with you. description: Adorable, comfortable, inviting, renovated 1918 log cabin convenient to everything in the Asheville area.  Although close in, you will feel like you are in the country.  Large fireplace, wood floors, and landscaped for privacy.  All amenities. This is a charming log cabin built originally in 1918. It has been renovated, however, do not expect this to be on Hilton Hotel standards.  It is clean but not spotless. Although it is close-in, you feel you are miles away from everything.  There is a water feature in the front and a creek along the back property line with lovely mature evergreens and Japanese maples in the yard. All amenities are included.  Please note the nightly price reflected in the listing changes depending on the day of the week and time of the year. ..sometimes lower and sometimes higher. description: This cozy one bedroom apartment is in a perfect location for enjoying everything that Asheville has to offer. We are minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and Bent Creek (Pisgah National Forest). So if you are coming to the mountains because of the mountains, this is the perfect place for you. Downtown Asheville is a destination of its own as well, and it is just a short drive (10-15 minutes) to the heart of this vibrant city. Whether you are here to see the Biltmore House, shop downtown,or find some great food and music, our location is ideal.       While close to all of the great things that make Asheville so interesting our place is located in a quiet and beautiful setting, open to the sky, yet surrounded by trees.  Our one bedroom apartment is approximately 800 square feet--small enough to be cozy but large enough to have everything you'll need. description: Imagine a 3 bdr mountain-top destination called Cloud 9- a private estate/farm, 15 min from the Biltmore Estate with a hot tub, full-length deck, wooded hiking trails, fishing, fresh eggs, and blueberries for you to enjoy.  Your peace of heaven. Cloud 9 Farm is in land conservancy application so you know that stewardship is important here. Go back in time to a simpler life of feeling like the valley farm is yours and the mountain-top dwelling in the clouds...your dream.  We are a gated mini-estate of 200 acres that you will be invited to. Pets love to run ahead of you on the hiking trails which you'll have full access to. The mountain top is yours...quiet! We work, you relax. Come join us in farm chores if you want the full farm experience, especially for the kiddos. Summer is fun to fish, pick blueberries and enjoy the open deck in the moonlight. The owners live in a separate house on the farm. What neighborhood? If you mean the cows and chickens, wild turkeys and deer...we've got 'em
